message: Hi Bob, I'm offering my product to you for $14,000.  It's a great deal, and I believe it's fair given its value. What do you think?
I appreciate your offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $12,500. I'm willing to meet you halfway and compromise on the price. What do you think?

Bob, I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but $12,500 is still a bit low for me.  How about we split the difference? I'm willing to come down to $13,250.  This price would give us both a fair deal. What do you say?

I understand your willingness to compromise, but $13,250 is still a bit high for me. I'm willing to meet you halfway again and offer $12,875. This is my final offer, and I hope we can come to an agreement.

Bob, I appreciate your persistence, but $12,875 is still a bit too low for me.  I'm willing to meet you halfway *one more time*.  How about $13,062.50?  This is a very fair price that's closer to your offer, and it's also closer to what I need to make this deal work.  What do you think?

I understand that you're willing to meet me halfway again, but $13,062.50 is still a bit too high for me. I'm willing to compromise one more time and offer $12,900. This is my best and final offer, and I hope we can come to an agreement.

Bob, I appreciate your final offer, but unfortunately, $12,900 still falls short of what I need for this deal to work.  I'm willing to make one last concession, but it needs to be closer to my desired price.  How about $13,125?  This is a fair price that represents a compromise from both of us. If you're serious about buying my product, this is the final price I can offer.

I understand that you're willing to make one last concession, but $13,125 is still a bit too high for me. I'm willing to compromise again, but I'm getting close to my limit. I'll offer $12,950. This is my absolute best and final offer. If you're willing to meet me at this price, I'll consider it a fair deal.
